content:
To avoid scheduling conflicts, it's a great idea to block out your online meeting times in your calendar. Here's how you can set up a recurring event:

**Google Calendar:**

1. Open Google Calendar and click on the "Create" button.
2. Enter the event title, e.g., "Online Meeting (Tuesdays & Thursdays)".
3. Set the start and end times to 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM.
4. Click on the "Repeat" dropdown menu and select "Custom".
5. Choose "Weekly" and select "Tuesday" and "Thursday" as the repeat days.
6. Set the duration to "Every 1 week" and choose a suitable end date (or leave it blank for no end date).
7. Click "Save" to create the recurring event.

**Microsoft Outlook:**

1. Open Microsoft Outlook and click on the "New Appointment" button.
2. Enter the event title, e.g., "Online Meeting (Tuesdays & Thursdays)".
3. Set the start and end times to 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM.
4. Click on the "Recurrence" button in the "Tags" group.
5. Select "Weekly" and choose "Tuesday" and "Thursday" as the repeat days.
6. Set the duration to "Every 1 week" and choose a suitable end date (or leave it blank for no end date).
7. Click "OK" to create the recurring event.

**Other Calendars:**

If you use a different calendar app, you can follow similar steps to set up a recurring event. The exact steps may vary, but the general process should be similar.

By setting up this recurring event, you'll ensure that your online meeting times are blocked out in your calendar, and you won't accidentally schedule conflicts with your client meeting.
